definitions.definition: To move , or appear to move, physically upwards relative to the ground.

examples: Disturbed by my footsteps, the birds rose above the treetops.

subdefinitions.definition: To grow upward; to attain a certain height.
examples: This elm tree rises to a height of seventy feet.
The path rises as you approach the foot of the hill.

subdefinitions.definition: To appear to move upwards from behind the horizon of a planet as a result of the planet's rotation.
examples: The sun was rising in the East.

subdefinitions.definition: To become erect ; to assume an upright position.
examples: to rise from a chair or from a fall

subdefinitions.definition: To leave one's bed; to get up .

examples: he rose from the grave;   he is risen !

subdefinitions.definition: To terminate an official sitting ; to adjourn .
examples: The committee rose after agreeing to the report.

definitions.definition: To increase in value or standing .

subdefinitions.definition: Of a quantity, price, etc., to increase .
To become more and more dignified or forcible ; to increase in interest or power; said of style, thought, or discourse.
examples: to rise in force of expression; to rise in eloquence;   a story rises in interest.

subdefinitions.definition: To ascend on a musical scale ; to take a higher pitch .
examples: to rise a tone or semitone

definitions.definition: To begin , to develop ; to be initiated .

subdefinitions.definition: To become active , effective or operational , especially in response to an external or internal stimulus .
examples: Thus far, my intellect has been able to rise sufficiently to meet every academic challenge that I have encountered.
As Patrick continued to goad me, I felt my temper rising towards the limits of my self control.

subdefinitions.definition: To develop , to come about or intensify .
examples: As hunger and despondency became more intense, a determination rose within me to find a way of getting off the desert island.

subdefinitions.definition: To swell or puff up in the process of fermentation ; to become light.
To have its source (in a particular place).
To become perceptible to the senses (other than sight).
examples: a noise rose on the air;   odour rises from the flower

subdefinitions.definition: To become agitated, opposed, or hostile; to go to war ; to take up arms ; to rebel .
To come to mind ; to be suggested; to occur .

definitions.definition: To go up ; to ascend ; to climb .
To cause to go up or ascend.
examples: to rise a fish, or cause it to come to the surface of the water
to rise a ship, or bring it above the horizon by approaching it

definitions.definition: To retire ; to give up a siege .
To be lifted, or capable of being lifted, from the imposing stone without dropping any of the type ; said of a form .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move , or appear to move, physically upwards relative to the ground.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To increase in value or standing .
To begin , to develop ; to be initiated .
( transitive ) To go up ; to ascend ; to climb .
( transitive ) To cause to go up or ascend.
( obsolete ) To retire ; to give up a siege .
( printing , dated ) To be lifted, or capable of being lifted, from the imposing stone without dropping any of the type ; said of a form .
